intro: Caesia comosa, commonly known as the showy beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Caesia comosa typically grows in moist, sandy soils in woodland or swampy areas. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 2 feet, making it a notable addition to native gardens.
